overview:
Mickey Hyunyu Kim is a Senior Business Development Manager at Google, managing Google TV partnerships. In this respect, Mickey has been leading partnerships with consumer electronics manufacturers to seek new opportunities with Google services and platforms with a focus on Google TV. Previously, Mickey was a New Business Development manager at Google, managing strategic partnerships for new business initiatives and new product incubation efforts. In this process, Mickey led partnerships for Googleâ€™s new business initiatives such as OpenSocial, Google Chrome Extensions and Googleâ€™s new publisher ad platform. Mickey was recognized for his contributions with two OC Awards, an award from Googleâ€™s top executives.

Mickey also has been serving as an advisor to various technology start-ups in the US and Korea and helping them with business development, funding and strategy. Mickey earned his MBA from the Haas School of Business at UC Berkeley where he was a co-president of the Haas Technology Club. Prior to Haas, Mickey was an international sales manager of mobile phones at Samsung Electronics and led Samsung Electronics to become a dominant market leader in the Israeli mobile market.

relationships.title: Head of Google TV Partnerships, Asia Pacific
